lead_paragraph: The president-elect’s three eldest children have always interwoven family and business ties. Can their empire ever be separate from the White House?
snippet: The president-elect’s three eldest children have always interwoven family and business ties. Can their empire ever be separate from the White House?...

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Susanne Craig, Michael Barbaro, Maggie Haberman, Steve Eder, Richard C. Paddock and Chris Dixon. Kitty Bennett, Doris Burke and Jeremy B. Merrill contributed research.
byline.original: By MATT FLEGENHEIMER, RACHEL ABRAMS, BARRY MEIER and HIROKO TABUCHI

abstract: Donald Trump's children, tasked with running his business empire while he is president, face tangle of conflicting interests exacerbated by fact siblings have spent their lives combining family and business; examination of professional histories of Ivanka, Eric and Donald Trump Jr shows how deeply Trump family, Trump business and Trump politics are interwoven, raising significant doubts about Donald Trump's ability to separate business from presidency.

headline.main: Business Since Birth: Trump’s Children and the Tangle That Awaits
headline.print_headline: Tangle Awaits 3 Trump Children Molded for Business Since Birth
